texts.translation:
Metal and light make a glint
Metal and stone make a spark
But metal and life makes death
First inscription of The Broken Poet

Two people and love will make many children
Two people and anger will make violence
Two gods and either love or anger will ruin many kingdoms
Second inscription of The Broken Poet

Blades or spikes or crushers are metal traps
Boulders or rollers or trap doors are stone traps
However, extreme beauty is a trap for the body and soul
Third inscription of  The Broken Poet

You can choose left or right
You can choose up or down
But you can never choose to turn back time
Fourth inscription of The Broken Poet

Some rooms are a floor, some floors are a building
Some buildings are a city, but many buildings are a kingdom
The greatest kingdoms produce poverty and chaos
Fifth inscription of The Broken Poet

One and two become three
Fire and plants become ash
Envy and desire can become a chasm in your soul
Sixth inscription of The Broken Poet

From 2 to 5 is far from fifty
From 6 to 25 is closer to fifty
From 26 to 49 as almost to fifty
But from 1 to infinity in time becomes 0.
Seventh inscription of The Broken Poet

All people are born, all people die
Eighth inscription of The Broken Poet

Two is more than one, one is less than two
The most is more than "more", the least is less than "less"
Average is more than "less", less than "more"
Most souls are average
Ninth inscription of The Broken Poet

The king is the most elevated person
And the citizens are many lesser people 
The king rules over many citizens
A wise king rules generously and with strength
10th inscription of The Broken Poet

A peaceful person has no weapon
A beautiful person has no bodily flaws
A happy person has no spiritual flaws
Nothingness can be a blessing
11th inscription of The Broken Poet

A generous person gives money to the poor
A selfish person does not give money to the poor
A selfish person has a poor soul
12th inscription of The Broken Poet

Light and dark are in harmony
Man and woman are in harmony
Fire and water are in harmony
All harmony was born in the void
13th inscription of The Broken Poet

Out is not in 
Dark is not light
Death is not life 
A punished person can have many negatives
14th inscription of The Broken Poet

Violence is anti-peace
Indifference is anti-love
Sadness is anti-happiness
Chaos is anti-order
Oppression is anti-freedom
Two wrongs do not make a right
15th inscription of The Broken Poet

"Never" is not the past, present, or future
I can never have freedom
16th inscription of The Broken Poet

A greedy person wants all the money
A rich person has a lot of money
A poor person receives little money
A selfish person gives no money
17th inscription of The Broken Poet

Sorrow is the greatest sadness
Rage is the greatest anger
Ecstasy is the greatest happiness
Sorrow, rage, and ecstasy all branches of life
18th inscription of The Broken Poet

The beginning is the most recent past
The end is the furthest future
The void is complete emptiness
The void was in the past the beginning, and will be in the future the end
19th inscription of The Broken Poet

A child worships an adult, and an adult worships a god
But a god will never worship
20th inscription of The Broken Poet

A child of few years is young
A young child is naive
A person of many years is old
An old person is wise
From youth to old age is the passage of all your years
21st inscription of The Broken Poet

A living person is when the body is animate and a soul is inside
A dead person is when the body is still and the soul is outside
I currently chooses life
22nd inscription of The Broken Poet

To stop is to end the end of the past
To be detained is to stop being free
To imprison is to detain for many years
A temple will imprison many phantoms for all time
23rd inscription of The Broken Poet

A growing plant requires light and water
A growing child requires the freedom to crawl and a true heart
24th inscription of The Broken Poet

texts.translation:
A person gathers blades to kill
A person gathers beauty to attract
A person gathers confidence to survive
But immortality can be a trap; The god is gathering relics to attract many sacrifices
25th inscription of The Broken Poet

You should place in your soul generosity, confidence, love, and wisdom
You should remove from your soul oppression, hatred, rage, and sorrow 
26th inscription of The Broken Poet

The past was, the present is, and the future will be
27th inscription of The Broken Poet

Money attracts those who want wealth
Beauty attracts those who want love
Chaos attracts no one
28th inscription of The Broken Poet

Head is the highest part of the body
And foot is the lowest part of the body
A hat is a head covering, a shoe is a foot covering 
But a crazy man will wear the shoe on his head
29th inscription of The Broken Poet

A young child fears the dark
An old man fears death
But all fear fades in time
30th inscription of The Broken Poet

Grandchild is the child of your child
Great grandchild is the child of your grandchild
Descendents are children, grandchildren, and great grandchildren
Time removed all descendents from awareness
And time will remove all descendents from everything
31st inscription of The Broken Poet

A temple is a building of worship
Sacrifice is choosing to release a phantom
Trap and a person's choice is a sacrifice
I will choose to sacrifice the future of all history
32nd inscription of  The Broken Poet

A crazy person jumps in trap to die
But a confident person jumps in a trap and can find a path to safety
33rd inscription of The Broken Poet

Immortality is to never die
Many people want immortality
But the mind wants wisdom and a painless death
34th inscription of The Broken Poet

An ocean is a lot of water
Thorns are the spikes of pants
Chasms are very deep pits
An explorer doesn't cross oceans, chasms or thorns in fear
35th inscription of The Broken Poet

To beg is to request chaotically
To demand is to request forcefully 
You should beg rarely and never demand
36th inscription of The Broken Poet

To answer is to give wisdom
You give an answer  to lose no money
37th inscription of The Broken Poet

To ignore is to chose to not see
Ruin is when everything is destroyed
You can ignore ruin, but you cannot ignore sadness
38th inscription of The Broken Poet

A wise person gives money to the gods
A happy god blesses the generous
But a hateful god gives nothing to people
And an angry god punishes the selfish
39th inscription of The Broken Poet

The heir is the oldest surviving descendent of the king
Some envious people want to rule
But the king rules the present, and the heir will rule the future as king
Having envy can never lead to happiness
40th inscription of The Broken Poet

Strong citizens choose to oppress
But only one out of 50 citizens can be strong
41st inscription of The Broken Poet

A relic is an atrophied (?)
A crown is the hat of a king
A promise today should be given in the future
The promise of a relic or a crown could be a trap
42nd inscription of The Broken Poet

Oppression is to rule with fear
Force is to oppress with violence
torture is continual violence 
An oppressive king rules with force and war
43rd inscription of The Broken Poet

A safe room has no traps
A trap room has many traps
Survival is to pass through a trap room alive
From birth to death there are many trap rooms
44th inscription of The Broken Poet

Crawling is the movement of a young child
You should first crawl to remove shoes
45th inscription of The Broken Poet

Growing is to create more
Atrophying is not growing and not remaining the same
You should grow now and never atrophy
46th inscription of The Broken Poet

To warn is to tell of traps
To deceive is to trap with what you tell
A prediction can offer you less deceptions and more warnings
47th inscription of The Broken Poet

A small chest contains few coins
A medium chest contains an average amount of coins
A large chest contains a lot of coins
And the earth contains a crazy amount of greed
48th inscription of The Broken Poet

Earth is where all civilizations reside
Hell is where all fallen souls reside
Heaven is where all ascended should reside
But my soul could be liberated or damned
49th inscription of The Broken Poet

An oracle sees predictions and the truth
An architect builds buildings and cities
A Warrior kills animals and people
A poet puts his soul into writing 
50th inscription of The Broken Poet

Good and bad temperment are opposites
Good temperment gathers meetings
Bad temperament gathers killings 
Good will always be better than bad temperment
51st inscription of The Broken Poet

Many citizens are low tier
Some citizens are mid-low tier
Architects and hunters are middle tier
Poets and oracles are mid-high tier
King and queens are high tier
52nd inscription of  The Broken Poet

Vines are happy plants on the temple wall
I am a sorrowful poet on the temple wall
I wants to be a vine
53rd inscription of The Broken Poet

A plant requires sun, water, and (?) to grow
A poet requires nothing but an empty soul to grow
54th inscription of The Broken Poet

texts.translation:
The sky is the home of the sun, moon, and stars
The sun provides light and heat
The moon and stars provide darkness and cold
A shooting star is a star that flies
Clouds can shade the sky
55th inscription of The Broken Poet

a stone that enters water will move downward
Water that enters the air will move downward
Air will never move downward
56th inscription of The Broken Poet

Hot metal and cold water created a blade
But a hot temper and a cold soul will collect that blade
57th inscription of The Broken Poet

A wealthy child and a poor child is all up to luck
But a child of a god will truly be the luckiest child of them all
60th inscription of The Broken Poet

A floor below and a ceiling above is a room
But a room with no door is a prison
61st inscription of The Broken Poet

A hall connects two rooms horizontally
A shaft connects two rooms vertically
A rotated hallway will become a shaft; a rotated shaft will become a hallway
You shall see forever the rotation of everything
62nd inscription of The Broken Poet

The Eye of Agony has killing lasers
The Masked Defiler has killing smoke bombs
The Devouring Rage has killing rage
You have nothing but your feet and whip
63rd inscription of The Broken Poet

An uncommon key has two pieces
A rare key has three pieces
A legendary key has five pieces
But the key to my heart has 54 pieces
65th inscription of The Broken Poet

????????
Betrayal is to kill a promise
The earth has many of the largest (?)
Trusting immortality (?) the greatest betrayal of all
65th inscription of The Broken Poet

A poet should be a person who writes the truth
But the oldest poet has few truths
Truth is to be naive for all time
66th inscription of The Broken Poet
